overview_of_class: Fundamentals of the 1st and 2nd laws of thermodynamics with special emphasis on applications of these laws to biochemical systems. Topics will be chosen from ideal and real gases, thermodynamics of solutions, membrane potentials, the hydrophobic effect, diffusion and molecular transport.
name: Physical Biochemistry
title: WCAS BIOL_SCI 321-0-20 Physical Biochemistry
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Students must have completed BIOL_SCI 215, 216, 218, 220, 221 and CHEM 103 or 172, and MATH 224, and either Physics 125-1, 130-1 and 136-1 or Physics 135-1 and 136-1 to enroll in this course.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Fundamentals of the 1st and 2nd laws of thermodynamics with special emphasis on applications of these laws to biochemical systems. Topics will be chosen from ideal and real gases, thermodynamics of solutions, membrane potentials, the hydrophobic effect, diffusion and molecular transport.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Must have BIO 215,216 or 219, 218, 220, and 221; Chem 103 or 172; Math 224; Physics 125-1, 130-1 or 135-1.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Three midterm exams and a cumulative final.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
The Molecules of Life, 2013, John Kuriyan, Boyana Konforti, David Wemmer, Garland Science,
ISBN 978-0-8153-4188-8

subject: BIOL_SCI
